title: Nueva Esperanza residents participated in environmental education sessions
text:
Photo Itaipu Binacional Asunción, IP Agency.- Itaipu carried out two days of environmental awareness in the communities near the Pozuelo Nature Reserve in which a total of 250 people participated, including teachers, students and parents.
The activities took place in Elementary School N° 1579 in the municipality of Puerto Adela and in Elementary School N° 4285 Don Carlos A. López in Colonia Itambey, district of Nueva Esperanza , Binacional reported.
Both events included interactive exhibits on air protection, water conservation, rational use of energy and solid waste management for recycling.
Furthermore, educational videos on climate change were shown, with a focus on solutions through individual and collective good practices. The students actively participated in the dynamics of correct waste separation, acquiring practical knowledge to apply in their environment.
Furthermore, the Binational has made key contributions to strengthen these environmental practices. It delivered selective bins for the separate collection of waste, as well as forestry and ornamental plants, to contribute to improving the school environment. The day in the municipality of Puerto Adela was accompanied by the municipal head, Agapito Melgarejo and his delegation.
Ignacio Riquelme, of the Itaipu Environmental Education Division, highlighted the importance of these border and transition areas, which are part of the Itaipu Biosphere Reserve (RBI). He highlighted that in this region there are communities that need comprehensive support to achieve their empowerment and sustainable development .
“These actions are part of our commitment to strengthen local capacities, contributing to the preservation of the environment and the well-being of communities,” said the professional. In this context, the Pozuelo Nature Reserve is one of the central nuclei of the RBI, which strengthens its fundamental role in conservation and ecological balance.
With these initiatives, Itaipu reaffirms its commitment to environmental education and sustainable development, providing tools to border communities so that they can actively participate in the conservation of their natural environment and in building a more conscious and balanced future.
